name.ch: 微奈米科技暨感測元件導論

department.en: Department of Biomedical Sciences and Engineering

goal.ch: Nanotechnology is a cross-disciplinary subject. Recently, it has developed from physics, chemistry, materials and electronics in the scientific field to biomedicine. The key factor is the advancement of material development and device design progress. This course will focus on the fundamentals and applications of nanotechnology, including intrinsic property of nanomaterial, manufacturing processes, analysis, and promising application for future sensor technology.
goal.en: Nanotechnology is a cross-disciplinary subject. Recently, it has developed from physics, chemistry, materials and electronics in the scientific field to biomedicine. The key factor is the advancement of material development and device design progress. This course will focus on the fundamentals and applications of nanotechnology, including intrinsic property of nanomaterial, manufacturing processes, analysis, and promising application for future sensor technology.

outline.ch:
Week 01     Introduction to Nano Technology
Week 02~04  Properties of nanomaterials –I, II, III
Week 05~07  Micro/Nano manufacturing Process-I, II, III
Week 08     Mid-term exam
Week 09~12  Micro/Nano material analysis -I, II, III,IV
Week 13~14  Sensor design-I, II
Week 15~17  Literature discussion and case sharing-I, II, III
Week 18     Final report
outline.en:
Week 01     Introduction to Nano Technology
Week 02~04  Properties of nanomaterials –I, II, III
Week 05~07  Micro/Nano manufacturing Process-I, II, III
Week 08     Mid-term exam
Week 09~12  Micro/Nano material analysis -I, II, III,IV
Week 13~14  Sensor design-I, II
Week 15~17  Literature discussion and case sharing-I, II, III
Week 18     Final report

textbook.ch:
Handouts will be given inside the course.
1.“D.A. Neamen, Semiconductor Physics and Devices”, 4th ed., McGraw Hill, 2011.2
2.Handbook of Semiconductor Manufacturing Technology, Edited By Yoshio Nishi, Robert Doering, 2008.
textbook.en:
Handouts will be given inside the course.
1.“D.A. Neamen, Semiconductor Physics and Devices”, 4th ed., McGraw Hill, 2011.2
2.Handbook of Semiconductor Manufacturing Technology, Edited By Yoshio Nishi, Robert Doering, 2008.

gradMethod.ch: Attendance 10％, Quiz tests 30 ％, Midterm exam 30％, Final Report 30％
gradMethod.en: Attendance 10％, Quiz tests 30 ％, Midterm exam 30％, Final Report 30％

en.competencies: Bridging the gaps from biomedical engineering to real-world medical challenges
